text:
To be fair, there’s not much else on the page, header footer a bit of get in touch text and the form, so no images other than logo’s to slow things down, so all the performance hit’s other than render blocking css (15kb) are basically from:
forms/v2.js
cta/current.js
HubSpots other tracking / banners
google analytics
Linkedin
Hotjar

I’m even a lazy old dev running jQuery and that doesn’t really have an impact. (Though I do now run a lot of native js and just use jquery for speed when building more long winded complicated stuff)
I think the HubSpot server was running faster yesterday…

Well that! was fun to troubleshoot:
• Client’s custom quotes suddenly stops displaying a range of Dropdown properties
• Template works fine in my staging portal, not in the client’s
• Try displaying the raw data on the template = Oh! It’s showing *Labels* instead of internal *values*!
• Quickly comment out all extra code to convert values to labels via dictionaries
• Display the raw properties (now are Labels) instead.
• Client templates working again. 
It would have been nice to know instead of causing a sales-team outage mid Friday :)
